str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of the base of homou and logos; to assent, i.e. Covenant, acknowledge.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
